thread.title: Donald Trump's Tweets Are Now Presidential Records
thread.title_full: Donald Trump's Tweets Are Now Presidential Records

author: The Conversation
title: Donald Trump's Tweets Are Now Presidential Records
text:
Donald Trump's Tweets Are Now Presidential Records The law says official presidential records must be preserved, and that includes tweets. By The Conversation | Contributor Feb. 1, 2017, at 3:00 p.m. President Donald Trump at Trump Tower on Jan. 9, 2017, in New York. (Evan Vucci/AP) 
By Shontavia Johnson 
By many accounts, Donald Trump's bold use of Twitter helped him get the attention and votes necessary to win a presidential race few initially thought he could. Given Trump's affinity for the social media platform, it was unsurprising that tweets began streaming from his @realDonaldTrump account before noon on Inauguration Day. 
Trump's first tweets as president included snippets of his inauguration speech, simple thank yous to supporters and a short clip of the Freedom Ball dance he shared with his wife. Within 24 hours, however, the new president stumbled up against complicated federal law when he (or one of his staff) tweeted, then deleted, that Trump was "honered" to serve as president .
